p: Unfortunately, racism in the face of humanitarian disasters has a much longer history than that of the current COVID‐19 outbreak. Human catastrophes are not just the result of natural phenomenon; they are linked to political, social and economic factors that create vulnerability to risk. Any response to a major disease outbreak is always deeply political. Racist fear mongering and pointing the finger of blame towards Chinese and Asian nationals may have contributed to the development of the current disaster. Several nurses and doctors have lost their lives to COVID‐19, including Dr Li Wenliang who was one of the first medical doctors to express concern about the emergence of a new SARS‐like illness in the Hubei province (Green, 2020).
